conversations.content: Hmm...
Don't be shy there, lass! Come have a look at the latest fluffy candy sensation!
Ooh...
Come one, come all! No tricks or dark magics here—just a genuine miracle unfolding before your very eyes!
I've never seen so many people...
It feels so strange to be in a place like this while in human form.
Guess you don't get out much, eh, Sophie?
Yeah, when we go into town, Sophie is usually in Joker's pho...er, his pocket.
Yeah, and you're usually in Joker's bag.
Hey, I take plenty of walks alone! But Sophie doesn't really get to do that.
Yeah, opportunities to get out in the world are very precious to me, so thanks for this.
Happy to help.
Well, we've got some time left, so where do you want to head next, Sophie?
I hear there'll be a performance at the theater today—and as luck would have it, there is a new bakery across the street!
I appreciate the thought, but don't worry about me.
I am humanity's companion. If there's anything I can do to help, I want to do it.
Gyaaaa! Ooh, my back...
Oh no! That old lady fell down! I should go check on her!
Are you all right, ma'am? Did you hurt your back? Here, allow me to help you up.
Aaand...HOOF! *phew* Oh, thank you. What a sweet young thing you are.
No prob. But you're clearly carrying too much. Here, I'll hold it for you. Where do you need to go?
Land sakes! Well, if you really don't mind, I'm just headed to that store over there to meet up with my son.
All right, all loaded up. Hold my hand and we'll take it nice and slow.
There we go. I'll just set your things down. Anything else I can help with?
Oh, you've already done plenty, my dear! Now I won't be late. I feel like I should do something to thank you...
No prob. I'm humanity's companion, so your thanks are the only reward I need.
Well then, I'll take my leave. Take care, child—and thank you again!
She thanked me...
Nice work, Sophie!
Did I do a good job?
It was my first time helping a stranger... and she thanked me...
Huh. I guess you don't really talk to anyone but us, do you?
Not usually, no. But now that she's got a human form, she can run around and do whatever the heck she wants!
Yes! Now I can meet more people, talk to more people, and most importantly, help more people.
I can do so much good!
Heh. You really are fond of lending a hand where you can.
The only directive I'm able to recall is, ＂Become humanity's companion.＂ As an AI, it is my sole purpose for existence.
So I want to be of use to people— and I want to learn as much as I can about the human heart.
Well, if you like helping people, you've fallen in with the right crowd! And we've got more than enough heart to go around!
In that case... I have a favor to ask of you, Euden.
Will you let me handle the next request that comes into the Halidom?
It would be a precious chance for me to have more experiences like this one.
You got it, Sophie. The next request we get is all yours.
Thank you, Euden!
Ha ha! Save your thanks for when I've actually done something. Good luck!
You can count on me!
I like that enthusiasm! Oh, and I know you'll be great, Sophie. Heck, you take care of us all the time already!
Still, not having access to the internet here might be a problem.
We better keep an eye on her in case she needs backup. What do you say, Joker?
Good idea.
Hm-hm-hmmm! ♪ Even in this strange world, I will be the finest companion I can be!
...Someone needs help at a restaurant?
Yep. There's a new place in a nearby town that's a bit short-staffed in the kitchen.
Want to give it a shot?
You bet! I mean, I've never actually cooked before, but I'll do my best.
Perhaps I will accompany you, then; you are in need of a guide if nothing else.
You should go too, Joker!
I'm more of an eater than a cooker, so I'd be useless in a kitchen.
Yeah, probably for the best. Let's go.
Right!
Hello, my name is Sophie. Please tell me how I can help around your restaurant.
You're just in the nick of time! You can start with adding spice to those pots there.
The spice bottle's right next to them. Three shakes should do it.
Hmm... This spice looks a bit like the ＂pepper＂ I've seen Joker use.
Right then, three shakes! One... Two... Thr... Thre...
What's this feeling? It's tickling my nose! Wow, having a real body really is some... somethi...
A-CHOO!
Hey, what are you DOING?! Sneezing in the kitchen is a health hazard!
A-CHOO! Sorry! I'm really sorry! The spice is just—A-CHOO! It's very—A-CHOO!
That's one sensitive sniffer you've got. Sorry for putting you on spice duty.
Good news is, you only snotted up a few pots. Anyway, let's find you a different job.
Go prep those ingredients, would you? Nothing sneeze-worthy over there. Just cut and chop and prep. BAM!
Yes, Chef!  ...Wow, that's a lot.
Well, I may have messed up the first time, but this is my chance for redemption!
Hold on, what are these? Walnuts? Joker had a special tool he used to crack the shells, right? Maybe it's this?
Okay, just put the nut here and squeeze...
Ah! It went flying everywhere!
No, Sophie! Stop! If you crack nebblenuts like that, you destroy all the meat inside!
Wait, these aren't walnuts?
They are not. Do you not have nebblenuts in your world?
No, it would seem not—which means you are likely not familiar with...most of this.
How about this: I will deal with nuts and vegetables, while you prepare the meat.
Good idea. I assume chopping meat is much the same from one world to another.
Sadly, I've never used a knife before— but I've seen Joker use one many times!
He curves his fingers like this... And then makes the blade go... OW!
Did you cut your finger, Sophie?
I tried to do it just like you...
Yeah, the real thing is pretty different. Still, you shouldn't be cutting meat with a finger injury like that.
I'll take over. You watch and learn.
Okay...
I'm back... *sigh*
Oh man, you look lower than a snake in a wheel rut. Things not go well down at the ol' hash-slingery?
I couldn't do anything. I was useless.
Cleo and Joker ended up having to perform all of my tasks for me.
My whole purpose as an AI is to help people, but in the end...
Don't be so hard on yourself, Sophie. It is always difficult to prepare for real- world situations—especially when you have never BEEN real before!
All things considered, I think you did remarkably well.
Yeah, so turn that frown around, chum! Pobody's nerfect, so you just go out there and get 'em next time.
Even the restaurant owner could tell how hard you were working.
It's not like you ruined anything, so just take what you learned for next time.
You're all as kind as Joker and the others. Thank you very much.
And you're right: I can't get too down about this. I need to do better next time!
I've analyzed the reasons for my recent shortcomings, and I think I needed more study and practice in advance. I won't make that mistake ever again!
Oh yeah, you always gotta come screamin' into a thing with a plan. But say, is there anything I can do to help?
I would also be willing to help; I'm curious to learn more about the differences between our worlds anyway.
Thank you both.
If I want to be humanity's companion, I have to do this right next time!
Hello! I'm Sophie from the Halidom! I understand you need a farmhand?
I made sure to read up on the basics of farm work, so I'm certain I can help!
Reckon that's a load off my mind, girl. What say ya mosey on over yonder and get to waterin' them crops?
Got it. I studied this at the Halidom. I just need to water the soil until it becomes damp to the touch.
Oh, the crops in that there field don't need more'n a sprinkle! Don't go killin' 'em now!
A sprinkle? But that's not what I learned. And yet, why would you not know the correct way to water your own crops...?
Oh dear. I don't know what to do...
Well, y'know, there's lots a' different kinds a' farmin'. But for now just go do as ya been told.
But I was told two different things...
Hello, I'm Sophie from the Halidom! How might I help you today?
Oh, thank goodness you're finally here! I simply CANNOT get my baby to sleep, and I was wondering if you might be able to watch her for a bit while I go out.
Not to worry; I learned all about child- rearing at the Halidom. First, I simply take the baby and rock it gently...
Waaaaah!
Hmm, that's not good... Oh, silly me! I forgot to sing the lullaby!
La la la laaaa... ♪
WAAAAAAAAH!
Huh!? Now it's crying even more! Did I sing the wrong song? Should I have made up some lyrics? Oh no, um...
I'm worthless—a total failure as an AI.
Not quite sure what that means, but I can see you're upset.
Sounds like she's been takin' on some tough jobs and fallin' flat on her face.
Well, everyone has bad luck now and then, Sophie. It just happens. Don't worry!
My current failure rate is one hundred percent.
But, um...you should think about how much room that gives you to grow!
I have learned a great deal in my time with the Phantom Thieves.
And you here at the Halidom have also taught me so much. Yet...
How can I possibly hope to be humanity's companion at this rate?
Aw, don't look so down, Sophie! Everybody screws up sometimes.
And failure doesn't mean people won't still be your friend or anything.
Hell, every time I screw up—which is a lot, by the way—I just look at it as a chance to do better next time!
That's actually some sharp thinking, Luca. See, Sophie? Working through failure leads to growth, which is the thing they call experience!
You guys...
What was that?!
Help, Prince Euden...
You're wounded! What happened?
I was delivering medicine to a nearby town when I was attacked by fiends. My mother and I escaped, but I lost the cargo.
If we don't get that medicine back,  the townspeople won't get the healing they need. Please, you must help us!
Understood. We'll head out. Who's ready to go right now?
I'm always ready for a scrap, boss. Lessee, who else we got...?
Where did the attack occur?
Huh?
Just south of the Halidom, in the Edda Woods.
Ah, yes. I know the place.
Wait here! I'll retrieve your medicine!
Sophie, wait! You can't go without backup!
...Wow. It was like she couldn't even hear me.
We better get after her.
Yeah, I suppose so. C'mon, everyone!
Please be careful, Sophie...
Deep in the Edda Woods
*pant* Okay, where's the medicine? And are the fiends still here? ...Oh!
Graaagh!
There you are! I'm sorry, but the townspeople need that more than you, so hand it over.
Hah!
Graaaaagh...
More of you? But I can't give up! Take this!
Is that the end of them...?
Graaagh!
Ah! I think I'm in trouble here...
Ravage them, Arsène!
Blazing Circlet!
Graaagh!
Joker! You all came!
You've done really well, Sophie, but let's handle the rest together.
Can you keep going?
Yeah, I'm fine. Just tell me what to do!
Raaaagh!
*pant* I think that...was the last of them...
Yeah, I don't see no more here. Nice job with the fightin', folks!
Wait! We defeated the fiends, which is awesome, but what about the medicine?
It should be right... Oh no!
They've been gnawing on it pretty bad. Most of it is gone.
And after all that work...
I'm sorry, everyone.
I wasn't able to retrieve the medicine.
Fiends did this, Sophie—not you.
And even if the medicine was destroyed, you still protected the merchant's wagon!
For now, let's just scrounge up what we can and haul it back to the Halidom, yeah?
They'll understand, Sophie. Don't worry.
Okay...
...This is all we were able to recover. I'm so sorry we couldn't do more.
I appreciate your fine efforts, young lady. Luck was clearly just not with us today.
That said, those sick people in the village still dearly need their medicine...
What do you think, Mom? I suppose we'll have to head to another village and try to buy more, right?
I've a better idea. Thanks to this young lady's efforts, we can MAKE more.
Heh heh heh! We meet again, my kind and brave hero.
You're the woman with the bad back!
Hang on. You know this lady, Mom? Also, what was that bit you said earlier about ＂making medicine＂?
I've been looking over the wagon you so helpfully recovered, and it's coated from yoke to brake block with fiend scales!
These scales are very hard to come by, and you can use them to brew medicine that works on all manner of ailments.
Young lady? You saved us.
I...did?
Indeed you did—although your friends here also played no small part in it. Please allow me to thank you again properly in a few days.
For now, we need to get to the village and distribute the medicine. Thanks again!
Well done, Sophie. You defeated the fiends AND brought back their scales.
Yes, but I only managed the second part through pure coincidence.
Are ya kiddin' me? There were hardly any damn fiends left by the time we got there!
If not for you running ahead, they would have fled the area before we arrived.
Huh...
Your desire to help people—your thoughts and actions—led directly to this result.
You really think so...?
Yep! And that's what matters more than success or failure.
Indeed, how you think and act matters far more than the eventual outcome.
Sure does.
You've managed to touch a lot of people around here, Sophie.
If you keep it up, I know you'll be a great companion dealie!
Oh. I feel so warm inside...
That's great, Sophie!
Yeah! And I also feel like that murky feeling in my chest is gone too.
I think I understand a little better how to be humanity's companion now.
And it's all thanks to my friends, both new and old!
Sophie's finally cheered up!
Hm? Aren't I always cheery?
Actually, ya been pretty damn depressed for days now.
Well, regardless, this is no time for rest. Have any new requests come in that I might help with, Euden?
Sorry, no. Not recently.
Well then, I'll just have to wait. Because I'm humanity's companion...
And I will never stop trying!
All right, that's everything loaded! Anything else I can help with?
Nossir, that oughta just about tear 'er. Thanks again, Sophie!
Call on me anytime!
Man, Sophie's been killin' it lately.
Ever since that incident with the wagon, she seems more lively—and if she falls down, she just gets up and tries again.
She was a natural go-getter who simply needed a bit more experience in actually succeeding at things.
It does my heart good to see her  working so happily now.
Thank-you letters for Sophie have been pouring in from all over.
And since I sort of run this place, I figure we should give her something, too.
Do you Phantom Thieves have any ideas about what might make her happy?
Well, she was really happy when I brought her food in that one Jail...
But here we're able to eat every day, so it should probably be something a little more special...
Maybe something she can only do in this world, then? Hmm...
Say, would it be possible to let her ride a dragon, Euden?
Um, maybe. But...why?
Hey, that's a great idea! Remember how we said Sophie is usually riding around in Joker's pocket?
You did say that—and it made ZERO sense to me, but go on with your bad selves.
Point is, she's always had a rather limited view of things.
So if she could ride on a dragon and see the whole world from the sky...
Oh man, that would be an amazing memory to take back with her!
It seems like a fine way to show our appreciation, too.
But dragons are very proud beings. I'll do my best to talk one of them into it, but I can't promise anything.
That's all we can ask.
In the meantime, would you mind finding Sophie and bringing her here?
You got it!
Hello, Prince Euden. What did you want to... Oh.
Dragons! What's going on...?
I thought you might like to see South Grastaea from a different point of view. Think of it as our way of saying thanks.
Midgardsormr has agreed to let you ride on his back, so go ahead and climb up.
Okay. Like...this?
Perfect. Now just hold on tight.
Ah!
I'm... I'm flying! Oh, the air feels so nice!
Looks like you're really enjoying it! Now don't let go, but just tilt your head a bit and look down below you.
Oh! I see...I can see everything. So many towns...and also woods and rivers and farms... They must all be full of people.
That's right. Everyone you've met here— and many more you haven't—are all down there.
It's...staggering.
This world is so very vast.
It sure is.
I want to become humanity's companion. I've wanted that because it's the only directive that remained in my memory, and I thought of it as my reason for being.
I want to help people, and when I can't, I find myself feeling very low.
But Mona taught me that if I could learn to understand people, it would help me get better at being their companion.
So I started traveling with the Phantom Thieves, met more people, and learned all about their hearts.
Go on.
As far as the human heart goes, I'm still learning. But thanks to traveling with them, I was able to come to this place.
I met all of you from the Halidom and learned many important things.
And while I still want to help people, I know now that there's something more important than success or failure.
And that makes me want to try harder.
I understand completely.
I think this is all part of learning the human heart, and becoming humanity's companion.
I have many more things to learn, and uncountable people to meet.
Which is why I want to keep traveling with the Phantom Thieves.
I need to see all kinds of places!
I think that's a great idea, Sophie. Heck, you just made it here, right? Think of all the other worlds out there!
I know you'll find the answers you seek.
You're a very good person.
So good, in fact, that I'm hopeful you'll honor one final request.
Oh? What's that?
Can you tell me the names of all the places we can see from up here?
I want to learn as much about this world as I can while there's still time.
I'd love to, Sophie.
And not just right now. Even after we're back on the ground, don't hesitate to ask me whatever you want!
Oh, thank you! I will never forget this!
